required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Hysterectomy on Quality of Life and Urethral Length
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Hysterectomy and Supracervical Hysterectomy on Quality of Life, Urinary Incontinence and Urethral Length

brief_summary.textblock: To establish the impact of hysterectomy on sexual function, urethral length and quality of life

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators evaluate impact of total hysterectomy (abdominal, by laparoscopy and vaginal) and supracervical hysterectomy (abdominal and by laparoscopy) on quality of life, sexual function, urethral length and urinary incontinence. The patients fulfill questionnaires (UDI 6, IIQ7, FSFI and ICIQ) before operation and 6 months after. Additionally the investigators measure urethral length before procedure and 6 months after.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline urethral length at 6 months after hysterectomy
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of urethral length before and after hysterectomy. Urethra will be measured during ultrasound examination in millimeters

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in sexual functions at 6 months after hysterectomy
secondary_outcome.description: The patients fulfill FSFI questionnaire before and after hysterectomy. Range 2-36 with higher scores indicating better sexual function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in appearance of urinary incontinence at 6 months after hysterectomy
secondary_outcome.description: The patients fulfill UDI 6 (range 0-400) questionnaire to assess appearance of urinary incontinence before and after hysterectomy

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in impact of urinary incontinence at 6 months after hysterectomy
secondary_outcome.description: The patients fulfill IIQ 7 (range 0-400) questionnaire to assess impact of hysterectomy on urinary incontinence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in urinary tract symptoms at 6 months after hysterectomy
secondary_outcome.description: The patients fulfill ICIQ questionnaire to assess impact of hysterectomy on urinary tract symptoms

arm_group.description: patients before and after total abdominal hysterectomy (TAH)
patients before and after total laparoscopic hysterectomy (TLH)
patients before and after total vaginal hysterectomy (TVH)
patients before and after abdominal supracervical hysterectomy (SAH)
patients before and after supracervical laparoscopic hysterectomy (SLH)

intervention.description: measure of urethral length, distribution of questionnaires before and after operation

study_pop.textblock: women who have been qualified to hysterectomy due to fibroids or other benign cndition and who had not undergone any vaginal operation in the past

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients qualified to hysterectomy due to benign condition
Exclusion Criteria:
- serious health condition
- previous vaginal operations
